foods.name: sugar
foods.explanation: Sugar is not easily processed by a diabetic person's body. Too much sugar can cause high blood sugar (hyperglycemia) which can cause increased thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, nausea and vomiting, shortness of breath, stomach pain, fruity breath odor, a very dry mouth, rapid heartbeat, and diabetic coma.
foods.suggestions: Sugar is important for bodily function, but sugar intake should be carefully monitored to avoid high blood sugar (hyperglycemia) and low blood sugar (hypoglycemia).

foods.name: sport drinks
foods.explanation: Sports drinks like Gatorade may be helpful for highly active, healthy people, but people with diabetes should steer clear—even if they hit the gym on the reg. They can be an unnecessary source of calories, added sugars, and sodium, which are all things people with diabetes should avoid.
foods.suggestions: Stay hydrated during your workout with cold H2O—it really is your best bet.

foods.name: nacho
foods.explanation: Nachos are high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat.
foods.suggestions: Use reduced-fat cheese and baked tortilla chips. Eat as a meal, not an appetizer.

foods.name: coffee
foods.explanation: Coffee drinks at places like Starbucks should be avoided as they are high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat. Coffee can be made in a healthier way, though.
foods.suggestions: Try a cup of coffee with a little skim milk.

foods.name: baked good
foods.explanation: Baked goods are high in calories, carbohydrates, trans fat, and sugar.
foods.suggestions: Some baked goods can be made healthier by using rolled oats, cornmeal, whole grain, or wheat flour.

foods.name: battered fish
foods.explanation: Battered fish is high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat. It has too much starch.

foods.name: canned vegetables
foods.explanation: Canned vegetables are generally okay but can be high in sodium.
foods.suggestions: Opt for raw or frozen vegetables instead.

foods.name: biscuit and gravy
foods.explanation: Biscuits and gravy are high in calories, saturated fat, and sodium.

foods.name: cereal
foods.suggestions: Make sure it's made with whole grain and watch for added sugar.

foods.name: chinese
foods.explanation: Many Chinese dishes are deep-fried and contain rice. These are high in calories and carbohydrates.
foods.suggestions: Avoid deep-fried entrees and rice. Dishes with no breading and a high vegetable proportion are okay.

foods.name: corn
foods.explanation: While corn is a vegetable, it is very starchy and high in carbohydrates.
foods.suggestions: Try other vegetables besides corn and potatoes.

foods.name: french fry
foods.explanation: French fries are high in calories, saturated fat, and sodium.

foods.name: fried chicken
foods.explanation: Fried chicken is high in calories, carbohydrates, and fat.
foods.suggestions: Try grilled chicken instead of fried.

foods.name: frozen meal
foods.explanation: Frozen meals are often high in fat and sodium. Pot pies are a huge offender.
foods.suggestions: Meals cooked from scratch can be made much healthier than pre-packaged frozen meals.

foods.name: fruit juice
foods.explanation: Many packaged fruit juices are high in calories and sugar.
foods.suggestions: Read the label. Be especially aware of service size. You can squeeze your own juice for a healthier option.

foods.name: hamburger
foods.explanation: Hamburgers are extremely high in saturated fat. Especially burgers from restaurants.
foods.suggestions: At restaurants, try to find healthier options by looking at any nutritional information they offer.

foods.name: lettuce
foods.suggestions: Most lettuce is great for you. Perfer other types over iceberg, as it's low in nutrients.

foods.name: lunch meat
foods.explanation: Pre-packed lunch meat is high in sodium.
foods.suggestions: Meat sliced at the deli department can be okay, but roasting and slicing your own meat at home with no added sodium is the best.

foods.name: milkshake
foods.explanation: Milkshakes are high in calories, trans fat, and sugar.

foods.name: pickle
foods.explanation: Most pickles are very high in sodium.

foods.name: Pizza
foods.explanation: Pizza is often high in calories, carbohydrates, fat, and sodium.
foods.suggestions: If you must eat pizza, opt for vegetable toppings. Pay close attention to the nutritional content and the serving size.

foods.name: potato
foods.explanation: Potatoes are high in carbohydrates.
foods.suggestions: Try other vegetables besides potatoes and corn.

foods.name: processed grain
foods.explanation: Processed grains are high in carbohydrates.
foods.suggestions: Some items that are typically made with processed grains can be made healthier by using rolled oats, cornmeal, whole grain, or wheat flour.

foods.name: sauerkraut
foods.explanation: Sauerkraut is high in sodium.

foods.name: smoothie
foods.explanation: Many made to order smoothies and smoothie mixes contain hidden sugars.
foods.suggestions: Make your own smoothies with fresh fruit and no added sugar.

foods.name: Soda
foods.explanation: Sode is very high in sugar.
foods.suggestions: Try sparkling water with fruit. Diet soda can also be okay.

foods.name: sweet potato
foods.suggestions: Pay attention to serving size, added sugar, and added butter.

foods.name: tortilla
foods.suggestions: Tortillas made with whole grain are much healthier than with other processed grains.

foods.name: vegetable
foods.suggestions: Try vegetables raw, steamed, roasted, or grilled. Avoid added butter, cheese, or sauce.

foods.name: whole grain
foods.suggestions: Watch out for added sugar.

foods.name: grilled chicken
foods.suggestions: Grilled is much healthier than frying chicken.

foods.name: sushi
foods.explanation: Most sushi dishes contain a lot of short-grain sticky white rice, which is very high in carbohydrates and should be avoided.
foods.suggestions: Try rolls made with quinoa, brown rice, lean proteins like fish, and healthy fats like avocado. Avoid deep-fried rolls. Opt for low-sodium soy sauce and watch out for added sugar.

foods.name: taco bell
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Opt for a black bean burrito, soft chicken tacos, or a fresco grilled steak soft taco.

foods.name: wendy
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Try a grilled chicken sandwich, power mediterranian chicken salad, or apple pecan chicken salad.

foods.name: burger king
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: A basic burger with no mayonnaise or a salad are better options.

foods.name: subway
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Opt for a 6 inch sandwich on honey oat or 9 grain bread, veggie delight, oven roasted/rotisserie chicken, or roast beef.

foods.name: arby
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Try a classic roast beef or turkey gyro pita wrap.

foods.name: mcdonald
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: A basic burger, side salad with baslamic dressing, apple slices, and unsweetened tea are some healtheir options.

foods.name: kfc
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Opt for grilled or baked chicken and sweet kernel corn over other options.

foods.name: chipotle
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Try a vegetarian or chicken bowl, crispy tacos with chicken, or brown rice.

foods.name: chick fil a
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: A grilled chicken sandwich, small fruit cup, and unsweetened iced tea are healtheir options.

foods.name: jimmy john
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Try the #1, Pepe un-wich style with no mayonnaise and thinny chips.

foods.name: panera
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Opt for a you pick two with half-smoked turkey breast on honey wheat loaf with low-fat garden vegetable with pesto soup, and acai berry iced green tea.

foods.name: popeye
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: The six-piece chicken tenders, regular green beans, and applesauce are healthier options.

foods.name: qdoba
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Try a naked burrito, pulled pork, pinto beans, lettuce, fajita vegetables, and mango salsa.

foods.name: starbuck
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Opt for a spinach and feta breakfast wrap. Black coffee is healthier than all of the sugary drinks they offer.

foods.name: panda express
foods.explanation: Fast food restaurants very rarely offer healthy options. However, some are better than others.
foods.suggestions: Broccoli beef (no rice) and veggie spring rolls are healthier options.
